item.title: The drain is blocked problem, 15th November
item.description:
I have damaged my vehicle due to colliding with a raised gully grating. It was so flooded i could not see anything and all of a sudden It burst my tyre and buckled my alloy. I am looking to make a claim.
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Litter Dump with Nox canisters, 15th November
item.description:
There is a litter dump, including Nox canisters in the bushes opposite the Greenways play area. There is also litter all around the tennis court that has been there for several weeks. ///Worry.pool.probe Sadly both are within meer metres of waste bins.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Greenways, Barnwood, Gloucester
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Litter in street or public area

item.title: HugePuddle, 15th November
item.description:
On the school run a huge puddle forms everytime it rains. While stood at the bus stop opposite the school I was soaked head to foot by a driver driving through this puddle. Luckily no children were near me. Someone managed to keep one drain fairly clear to allow children to cross the road. The flooding also goes into the park entrance so children and parents have to wade in the water to access the safe route back towards wymans brook.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1, Church Road, Kingsditch, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Collapsed/Disconnected Drain, 15th November
item.description:
Drain overflowing at slight rainfall - I think this is the 4th time I’ve reported this drain. The two drains further down the hill from this are the same. They overflow at the slightest rainfall, I suspect they’re collapsed somewhere. Hosing them out as has been done repeatedly in the past doesn’t work. They need inspecting and repairing properly.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Kidnappers Lane, Warden Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Damaged Drain, 15th November
item.description:
Drain overflowing at slight rainfall. The two drains further up the hill from this are the same. They overflow at the slightest rainfall, I suspect they’re collapsed somewhere. Hosing them out as has been done repeatedly in the past doesn’t work. They need inspecting and repairing properly.

item.title: Drain collapsed, 15th November
item.description:
I think this is the 4th time I’ve reported this drain for overflowing. The drains either side of this up and down the hill are the same. They overflow at the slightest rainfall, I suspect they’re collapsed somewhere. Hosing them out as has been done repeatedly in the past doesn’t work. They need inspecting and repairing properly.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 123, Church Road, Leckhampton, Cheltenham

item.title: Drain Issue on Vineyard Street, 14th November
item.description:
Drain outside Number 13 Vineyard Street is still not working. I don't know how many time I have to report this. This must be solved. This has been like this since Dec2024 as far as I can tell, but neighbours told me it's always been an issue.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Vineyard Street, Winchcombe, Winchcombe
Report on FixMyStreet
